channel.title: Ruby
channel.description: Is Ruby A good first language, What is it Generally Used for? I like web Development but also wanna start General Programming should i learn Ruby or is there something better?

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

Whackatre:

Ruby and C are the ultimate starting languages (for generally casual and generally academic reasons, respectively).

How is python not the starting language?

Read full topic

Ruby and C are the ultimate starting languages (for generally casual and generally academic reasons, respectively).

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

You obviously can't be serious either that or you have no idea what you're talking about lol. To even understand the language it could take a great deal of time and to learn it it takes a lot longer than that, I know people who have studied C++ for years upon years and wouldn't even say they're a competent programmer while writing in that language.

I’m saying it would take a few weeks to get the general idea of the language. It would take anybody a long time to actually start programming decent with any language. C++ is just easier to learn if you have some aspects of programming knowledge, I’m actually working on a server written in c++ and i’m hoping to release the framework for it in the near time future.

Read full topic

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Ruby or Java are both great languages to learn since both have a good backing in web development. But I think you should learn the superior Erlang programming language.

Read full topic

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:7, topic:509078”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=627318.msg4262916#msg4262916 date=1363630914]

Java, c++, python is what I would recommend if you want to learn ruby feel free to do so.

You would recommend to have their first language as C++?
[/quote]

I actually found it really easy to understand and the language does not take much time to learn.[/quote]

This isn’t learning fully the language.

Read full topic

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:6, topic:509078”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=627318.msg4262913#msg4262913 date=1363630846]It will also learn you a lot about object orientated programming which is good no matter if that’s the language you end up being serious about.
[/quote]
What makes OOP good, Mr. Ruby?[/quote]
I think you already know the answer so I don’t even know why I’m replying to it but OOP gives a clear structure towards your code which allows for easier editing by fellow developers and for people merely to inspect the code. It’s easier to maintain the existing code. The list goes on and on ;).

[quote=“317guy, post:9, topic:509078”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=627318.msg4262913#msg4262913 date=1363630846]

Is Ruby A good first language, What is it Generally Used for?
I like web Development but also wanna start General Programming should i learn Ruby or is there something better?

I personally think Ruby is a great first language for anyone, you can also take a look at Ruby on Rails if you’re interested in website development. It will also learn you a lot about object orientated programming which is good no matter if that’s the language you end up being serious about. It’s definitely worth a look at in my opinion.
[/quote]
I find it funny that Someone Called Ruby Answered my Question about Ruby
I did’nt think Ruby was used for Web Development may i ask what’s “Ruby On Rails”[/quote]
Rails is a website development framework written for Ruby and is more or less the framework that brought Ruby to be a more recognised language.[quote=“Arcik, post:7, topic:509078”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=627318.msg4262916#msg4262916 date=1363630914]

Java, c++, python is what I would recommend if you want to learn ruby feel free to do so.

You would recommend to have their first language as C++?
[/quote]

I actually found it really easy to understand and the language does not take much time to learn.[/quote]
You obviously can’t be serious either that or you have no idea what you’re talking about lol. To even understand the language it could take a great deal of time and to learn it it takes a lot longer than that, I know people who have studied C++ for years upon years and wouldn’t even say they’re a competent programmer while writing in that language.

Read full topic

It will also learn you a lot about object orientated programming which is good no matter if that’s the language you end up being serious about. It’s definitely worth a look at in my opinion.[/quote]

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“317guy, post:1, topic:509078”]Is Ruby A good first language, What is it Generally Used for?
I like web Development but also wanna start General Programming should i learn Ruby or is there something better?[/quote]
I personally think Ruby is a great first language for anyone, you can also take a look at Ruby on Rails if you’re interested in website development. It will also learn you a lot about object orientated programming which is good no matter if that’s the language you end up being serious about. It’s definitely worth a look at in my opinion.
